title: SiteObservationView
description: <font color="#4f81bd">SiteObservationView</font> is a simplified view of a generally point-located geological observation, like a structural measurement. This is a simplified instance of a sampling geometry from Observations & Measurements (ISO19156) with an associated geological observation. Each tuple should represent a single observation. Key property values are summarised as labels (unconstrained character strings) or arbitrarily selected classifiers to be used for thematic mapping purposes. The latter are the properties suffixed with “_uri” and will contain URIs referring to controlled concepts in published vocabularies.

identifier.title: identifier
identifier.description:
Globally unique <font color="#4f81bd">identifier:Primitive::CharacterString</font> shall uniquely identifies a tuple within the dataset. Identifiers shall be formatted as URI according to RFC 3986.  This URI could be used to access more detailed, such as a GeoSciML Basic, representation of the feature.

The URI should resolve to an instance of OM_Observation.

siteName.title: siteName
siteName.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">siteName:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains the name of the sampling feature at this location (e.g. a station number, a borehole).

observationName.title: observationName
observationName.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">observationName:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a text identifying the observation.

label.title: label
label.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">label:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a short text string to associate with a symbol in a visualization/portrayal.

description.title: description
description.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">description:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a text string providing descriptive information about the observation.

featureOfInterest.title: featureOfInterest
featureOfInterest.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">featureOfInterest:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a description of the geologic feature that the observation is intended to characterize, e.g. foliation (observed property= orientation), a geologic unit (observed property = age, magnetic susceptibility, density, uranium content).  The property is equivalent to O&M <font color="#4f81bd">OM_Observation::featureOfInterest</font>. To report a URI of the feature of interest, <font color="#4f81bd">featureOfInterest_uri</font> shall be used.

observedProperty.title: observedProperty
observedProperty.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">observedProperty:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a description of the property reported in this record. (E.g. orientation, age, density, gold content) as a human readable text. To report an identifier of the observedProperty from a controlled vocabulary, <font color="#4f81bd">propertyType_uri </font>shall be used.

observedValue.title: observedValue
observedValue.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">observedValue:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains the result of the observation. This field is implemented as a character string to allow reporting various type of values, the value may be numeric (e.g., 235) or textual (e.g., red). Units of measure shall be reported in <font color="#4f81bd">observedValueUom</font>.

observedValueUom.title: observedValueUom
observedValueUom.description: If relevant, the property <font color="#4f81bd">observedValueUom:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains the unit of measure for a numerical value of an observation or measurement, preferably from a controlled vocabulary.

observationMethod.title: observationMethod
observationMethod.description: If present, the <font color="#4f81bd">observationMethod:Primitive::CharacterString</font> property contains a method description, preferably a term from a controlled vocabulary, to categorize the observation method. Further details on procedure can be put in the source field.

positionalAccuracy.title: positionalAccuracy
positionalAccuracy.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">positionalAccuracy:Primitive::CharacterString</font> provides an estimate of the position uncertainty for the site location. For numerical measurements, include a unit of measure in the description. (e.g., 50 metres, poor, good).

source.title: source
source.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">source:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a text description of measurement procedure, processing, and provenance of data.

featureOfInterest_uri.title: featureOfInterest_uri
featureOfInterest_uri.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">featureOfInterest:Primitive::CharacterString</font> is functionally equivalent to <font color="#4f81bd">OM_Observation::featureOfInterest</font> of IS19156.  It contains a URI link to a representation of the feature of interest (e.g., a GeoSciML geologic unit or structure).

propertyType_uri.title: propertyType_uri
propertyType_uri.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">propertyType_uri:Primitive:CharacterString</font> is functionally equivalent to <font color="#4f81bd">OM_Observation::observedProperty</font>.  It contains a URI to a term from a controlled vocabulary of observed property types.

metadata_uri.title: metadata_uri
metadata_uri.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">metadata_uri:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a URI link to metadata document.

genericSymbolizer.title: genericSymbolizer
genericSymbolizer.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">genericSymbolizer:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains an identifier for a symbol to portray this observation. Conventions for symbol identifiers can be adopted within information exchange communities.

symbolRotation.title: symbolRotation
symbolRotation.description: If present, the <font color="#4f81bd">symbolRotation:Integer</font> property contains an integer value between 0 and 359 to specify rotation of symbol at this location, e.g. rotation of a geologic strike and dip symbol to reflect the strike azimuth.  The angular convention shall be geographic angle (clockwise with 0 at geographic north pole, therefore 90 degree is east).

any-1.title: any
any-1.description: A data provider can add an arbitrary number of extra properties, as long as the instance is conformant to GML Simple Feature Level 0.

any-2.title: any
any-2.description: A data provider can add an arbitrary number of extra properties, as long as the instance is conformant to GML Simple Feature Level 0.

any-3.title: any
any-3.description: A data provider can add an arbitrary number of extra properties, as long as the instance is conformant to GML Simple Feature Level 0.
